reviews.review: holy shit just buy it now
Well worth the $9 that I spent during the Winter sale.  Amazing game!

This is one of the best games I have played in a very long time. It was sufficiently interesting all the way up until the end, which was undoubtedly the best part. Never have I seen a developer make such a spiritual video game. This game has meaning that transcends the fact that it is simply a video game. Any person who is keen on the more intangible things in life and wishes to experience an example of the infinite nature of our universe, and the multiverse, should play this game from start to finish. 9.5/10

Потрясающая игра, великолепный сюжет, изумительная графика!
Ее стоит просто увидеть, чтобыв полюбить навсегда!
Geniales Spiel macht einfach nur Fun
Super Spiel,auch wenn die ersten beiden Teile besser sind!!
One of the best games I've ever played!
I didn't like the game. The storyline was not as good as number one.It had its momnets and its meanings , but it had so many the story just didnt live up to it.

Gameplay is repetitive as ♥♥♥♥. Missions are sometimes totally pointless. For example I found the gunsmith after all the ♥♥♥♥ I had to go through and then plot twist and now the ♥♥♥♥er has lost his tools. So now I have to go find them. WHY?!?!!! 

Vigors are really crap against enemies with most of them being really underpowered and more for visual effect than actual practical use and whilst interesting to see their effects the first time, this quickly wears off. 

You can only carry two weapons and later on when you don't have the two strongest weapons in the game at your disposal, you're ♥♥♥♥ed basically. Gears are 90% full of ♥♥♥♥. I wasted 5 lockpicks on a door that had a gear in it that allowed me greater control over how fast/slow I went on skylines, WTF?!! 

Ammo is also THE SAME PRICE FOR EVERY AMMO TYPE: $8. Insanely cheap. And the vigor upgrades are insanely expensive. Like $1500 to add a cluster bomb effect to your Devil's kiss which is underpowered anyway.

It's clear that the devs were not focusing on gameplay at all. Not one bit. As the gameplay mostly consists of: "Go there and find him or go there and find that". 

One of the most overhyped and overrated games of 2013 IMO.
Great story drivin experience enforced by great gameplay. Its great. Buy it. I command you!
I came here to see lovely sights and hear lovely sounds, so could you please put down that bazooka, ok?

Simply brilliant a story driven masterpiece
This game sold me at the damn trailer. The story dwelves deeper than any modern game, with developing characters more life-like than the Half-Life series. 10/10
On of my favorite games of last year. The action and gunplay was much better then expected and the story was suspensful and exciting.
Eines meiner Top3 Spiele 2013. Auch wenn es vom Spielprinzip nur ein normaler Shooter ist, ist die Story doch so fesselnd, dass ich nicht mehr aufhören konnte.
Gameplay szału nie robi, ale fabuła jest ciekawa a pokręcony, steampunkowy klimat Bioshocka jest intrygujący.

Infinite remains one of the finest single-player campaigns in terms of story and narrative. Fantastic atmosphere is maintained throughout thanks to beautiful steampunk-inspired settings and brilliant sound design, and the story itself is gripping and powerful.

The game's only real let down is the gameplay itself - passable shooting mechanics with little variation across the campaign makes for standard, uninspiring fare. This seldom overshadows the engrossing narrative however: a fantastic single-player experience, one of the best since Half-Life 2.
This game is fucking awesome !
wege swag

Играется на одном дыхании. Драматизм. Экшн. Внезапность. Сюжет как водится совсем не тривиален. Скльо было съедено авторами веществ не представляю. Графика в игре невероятно настоящая, почти как кино смотришь. Устал делать скриншоты.

Одна из игор с безупречным сюжетом, после прохождения которого ощущаешь отвал башки и летнюю печальку (саммартайм сэднэсс), причем это касается как самой игры, так и длс. Уже семь лет с выхода прошло, а Лизка все равно топовый женский персонаж, переплюнуть которого нынешней сжв-повестке будет непросто еще пару десятилетий. А еще я так и не определился за семь лет, какой энергетик в этой игре люблю больше всего. В общем, данная игра однозначно должна находиться в коллекции каждого трезвомыслящего гражданина планеты Земля.
This is one of the best single-player games I have played and the most mindfucked one ;)

Sinceramente, el mejor juego que he jugado en mi vida, lo recomiendo hasta el infinito!! Es un juego perfecto y redondo, su música, su ambiente, sus gráficos.. pero sobre todo lo que te dejara con la boca abierta es su enrevesada historia, cuando llegues al final te quedaras boquiabierto creedme, y ademas querras rejugar el juego para enterarte de todo mejor, te enteraras mucho mejor y te gustara el doble si has jugado al Bioshock 1 pero aunque no lo hayas jugado te enteraras muy bien de este juego, lo digo yo que aun no he jugado al 1 
Aunque costara 1000 euros este juego es de compra obligatoria si o si, antes de morir tienes que jugar a esta obra maestra que deberian de considerar una maravilla del mundo.

даже минусом считать нельзя, так, как игра ценится своим сюжетом.
Игра приносит больше вопросов, чем ответов и это мне чертовски нравится.
Я знаю, конечно, что это дело вкуса ,но я просто не могу не по рекомендовать всем пройти эту игру и надеюсь вам прохождение этой игры понравится также как и мне.

Ругать BioShock Infinite решительно не за что. Это умный шутер – от него в процессе получаешь искреннее удовольствие от самой механики стрельбы, чередования оружия и способностей героя. Прекрасная и законченная история с – в кои-то веки! – закрытым финалом. Один из самых удачно реализованных в рамках геймплея и нарратива женский персонаж - с Элизабет просто не хочется расставаться после завершения игры. Недостатков абсолютно нет. 10 из 10.

Игра ончень классная! Но почините достижение "Испорченный праздник
В пьяном виде вы убили 5 противников." Я всю игру бухим в говно прошел, а достижение не открывается(((
Non è un gioco ,è un capolavoro!!!
ein sehr gutes Spiel!!!

Utterly Amazing. Solid 10/10 in my book.

A must have for those who are into storylines with many twists and turns. Gameplay is equally good with many ways to go about doing things. Characters have distinct personalities.
Es ist Leviosa.
One of the best FPS ever made. 10/10.

Игра, конечно, отличная! Впрямом смысле этого слова отличная и отличная от других. Никогда не играл ни в один Bioshok и к этой игре относился скептически с самого начала. Начав играть ничего интересного не увидел, шутер шутером с интересной графикой и рисовкой, но через полчаса, найдя цель нашей миссии, а именно Элизабет, началось... Шутер превратился в изумительное приключение со стрельбой, взаимодейсвием с окружающим миром, позволяя получать тактическое преимущество. Игра затягивает, привлекая хорошим сюжетом, неожиданными поворотами. Приятно видеть, что разработчики делали игру не на коленках, а подошли к этому процессу ответственно и в итоге получился динамический котейль, который обязателен к прохождению всем.

이전 시리즈와는 달리 좀 밝은 분위기긴 하지만 그 나름의 신선한 분위기라 좋습니다

더구나 혼자 플레이하면서도 뭔가 같이 하는 사람이 있는 것 같은 느낌을 줘서 괜시리 마음이 훈훈해지네요 ^^

Sehr cooler Shooter! Extrem gute Grafik, der Sound ist klasse und die Story hat mich schön abgeholt, obwohl ich die verherigen Teile nicht gespielt habe. Aber anscheindend ist das ja eh egal.
Die Kräfte, die man einsetzen kann sind teils zu gebrauchen, teils überflüssig. Ich glaube ich habe im ganzen Spiel nur zwei wirklich verwendet. Die Waffen müssen eigentlich auch nur wegen Munitionsmangel durchgewechselt werden. Hat man alle Waffen etwas gelevelt, spielt das aber keine Rolle mehr.
Als ich Elizabeth das erste Mal sah, dachte ich nur "Oh nein, bitte keine Escort-Missionen!" Zum Glück kommt aber gleich nach Einführung des Charakters der Hinweis, dass sie selbst auf sich aufpassen kann und man sich nicht um sie kümmern muss. Funktioniert meist auch ganz gut, auch wenn sie manchmal aus dem Nichts auftaucht, plötzlich hinter einem in der Ecke steht oder einfach keine Lust hat, in den Aufzug zu steigen. Komisch, aber OK.
Hab mir jedenfalls den DLC besorgt - mal schaun was die Story noch so zu bieten hat. Ich freu mich schon!

A definately "similar-yet-different" addition to the fantastic Bioshock franchise. Columbia, as it's called, is one of the most beautiful and imaginative worlds in gaming yet seen.
The game focuses heavily in its themes of nationalism, politics, and race and class seperation, but does so intelligently and not so bleeding-heart either. As soon as you are spilled into Columbia, you are given a set of increasinly zainy and deadly weapons and paranormal abilities. Dispatching foes is a manic and fun time, and your AI partner does well to help you when she can, and stay out of your way when you don't need it.
It's a very story-driven game, but in a good way. While you might find long spells without any real fighting sequences, the diologue, visuals, and story being conveyed are enough to keep you interested. From start to finish, Bioshock Infinite is a thrilling title, with unique but familiar action, and its gripping story that WILL BLOW YOUR FREAKIN' MIND at its steller conclusion.

Everything about this game is epic... the graphics, the story, the characters, the atmosphere, the graphics...

What the hell is wrong with you, guys? No, not you gamers, the developers. They removed everything bioshock... well, technically system shock, but I wont split THOSE hairs right now, from this game. Choice is meaningless. Kill everyone you want, it doesn't matter. Make all your in game choices by flipping a coin, it doesn't matter. Dozens of plots are dropped into your lap and then shatter away to be forgotten without a thought. I hope you kids enjoy Songbird... for all 15 seconds you will see him. He's hyped to hell, but has absolutely no impact on the story or the game in general. But I can forgive a lot, I can... I will not, however, forgive this game's ending. I saw it and stared quietly for some time going "huh?" until I managed to piece it together myself and come to a conclusion. The writers were extremely high. Not the good "purple haze" kind of high, but the stoner in the basement giggling about God spelled backwards kind of high. In the span of 3 minutes you render the entire game moot, undo your own story, then actually go back and retroactively write the first two games out of existance. I'm not kidding about that, BTW, the forshadowing is strong with this and there are little clues that state the first two games are just this game in a different universe... and you proceed to unmake them all. You not only ruined your current game, you went back in time and ruined your first two games as well. What the HELL is wrong with you? Then you have the nerve to release this DLC featuring Rapture... even though you changed things in such a way that the city couldn't even exist. Your writing is so horrible you lost track of your own ending while you were writing it then forgot it again when you made your DLC. Oh, and before I forget, your game play was utter crap. Two weapon rule wasn't fun in the 90s, it damn sure isn't fun now. Your combat is boring enough to be seen as a chore. In short, you could not have failed harder as a game publisher if you'd simply sent us a fresh turd in a box.

wonderful narrative and characters you're bound to fall in love with. the game provides a deep world and an exciting story to guide you through it. awesome singleplayer story with great combat to go with.
Amazing game favorite of all time, no other game is going to top this game in my opinion very easily.

10/10.

 I cannot say that this is enough said, because it was definitely one of my finest buys. Nearly my favorite storyline to any game; it would keep you playing for hours and you never know what was around the corner (unless you had already played it of course). Plot twists jumped out and kept you thinking, at times making you try to fathom what in the world just happened. Once you complete it once- it would be likely that you would play it again, just so you can try to wrap your head around the twisting plot. It was fast paced and one hell of a ride that you will never forget after experiencing it once. 

With that said- every penny spent to get the game was worth it.
this game was god damn amazing in every way.
Amazingly well written story line. While it's not as creepy and scary as its predecessors, the characters and challenges will have you playing this for hours until you finish it. Great game.

Despite this game receiving a majority of popular feedback, I find it falls very short as a game. I do however feel that it is a fantastic piece of art. The environments are gorgeous, and exploring Colombia were rather enjoyable. Also the story was well told and quite moving despite some gaps in continuity. However that's the extent of its positive qualities.

As game it fails to be challenging, even on Hard mode the combat is incredibly trivial. Elizabeth can keep you feed with an infinite supply of ammo, health, and salts, which you don't even need because you can just kill everything with the skyhook. Aside from the combat the game was incredibly linear, with very few secrets, and of those that did exist none really provided any substantial benefit because the combat was so easy to begin with.

And again back to the problems with it being so linear, I can't help but compare it to the first Bioshock, which was also linear, however at least had multiple endings. With Bioshock: Infinite there is one ending, and honestly it's not that good. For a game that has a theme of infinite worlds with infinite possibilities you have only one ending? Really?

To sum it all up it's just not a good game; like I said the story was pretty good, but the combat is poor, and the player cannot change the outcome of the ending. In terms of gameplay it's more like Myst or Riven than a shooter. It's just a beautiful enviornment to explore. However, unlike Myst or Riven, Bioshock: Infinate is devoid of any choice or challenge. Overall I'd have to say that you would probably be better off just watching all the cutscenes on youtube, because it would make a better movie than a game.

As I compared BioShock 2 to BioShock 1, so shall I compare BioShock Infinite to BioShock 1 and 2. BioShock Infinite is leaps and bounds better than both BioShock 1 and 2, in many respects. First, the bad: the gunplay feels a bit restricted, compared to BioShock 2, although it's much better than BioShock 1. You can only hold two weapons at a time, and unlike BioShock 1 and 2, you don't get to hold onto all your other weapons when you find new ones. However, even with this major stifling to the creative gunplay of BioShock 2, BioShock Infinite is much more fun to play and combat feels incredibly rewarding. I enjoyed using every weapon and plasmid - erm, I mean vigors - even though some got more use than others. Also the vigors really don't add much to the story, unlike the plasmids of BioShock 1 and 2 did.

Infinite is a game worth playing despite those minor gaffes, and what a game it is. The story is well written, well voiced, and well developed, despite a slow ascent to an ending that nearly drops you off the cliff it happens so fast. The locales are beautiful, artistic, and infused with enough alternate history nuggets that you want to explore every part of it, even if the characters and themes within are a bit unsettling. Unlike 1 and 2, Infinite's backdrops are colorful and varied enough that you never feel tired of traversing through them. 

If you enjoyed Bioshock 1 and 2, Infinite is a no-brainer. Give it a shot - you'll enjoy it. If you didn't like BioShock 1 and 2, but you like colorful, full voice acted, ambitious games that reward you for exploring its world and playing smart, then give Infinite a chance.

It's like BioShock candy, after the sirloin of BioShock 1 and t-bone steak of BioShock 2.
- Feels shorter, but way less grindy as each new area is pretty unique.
- Story is linear (not as open-worldy) which helps keep you from ever getting lost (there's even a "which way do I go?" button you can spam).
- Completely fresh plot (alternate history with an imperialist tongue-in-cheek christian america) makes the game worth the money.
- In-game companion (and the whole plot) makes the game enjoyable.
- Can only carry two guns at a time, but the ammo pool is persistent.  It's fine.
- Plasmids replaced with tonics (and are not responsible for the chaos of the world), you could almost avoid using them.
- New enemies, flying around using skylines (and killing things while doing it), occasional custscenes, and a few interesting collectibles really flesh out the game.
- You do not need to have played the earlier games to enjoy this one.  You would probably enjoy BioShock 2 after playing it, but BioShock 1 might feel like a bit of a downgrade from a gameplay standpoint.
- It's not a tough game on normal.

Bottom Line: I'd value the at about $30, yet it looks like you can do much better in the next big sale.

One of the greatest games I've ever played. Blew through it in two sittings; some of the most enjoyable 11 hours of my life. Recommend playing it with a controller. It'll fuck with your mind and the last hour won't make any sense at first, but then it DOES AND IT'S AMAZING. Also, Elizabeth is the stronges female character in video gaming probably ever. Very few to zero bugs, the battle mechanics are fluid and enjoyable, and the Vigors are very fun. Plus one huge epic reference to BioShock 1 that'll also blow your mind. Play it and enjoy!

Great game, but not without its flaws. I suppose it's a matter of preference, but I enjoy games that are not so linear and allow more exploration. That's not what you'll get with this game. You are led through each part of the game with no option to go back and look for any hidden treasure/open any locked doors for which you had not enough lockpicks. Probably meant to encourage being replayed, but with such a linear style of gameplay, I wouldnt play it through again. All and all though it was a great game with a fantastic storyline. The maps are fantastic and beautiful to look at. There are a limited number or weapons and the vigors are a nice touch, but you don't absolutely have to use them. On top of that, the AI isn't really that great. You can hide aand they won;t try and find you for the most part.
